intro: Rourea florida, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its bark is fibrous and often flaky. Rourea florida thrives in coastal areas and is well adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii.
